subtitle: A whole new world for your baby
description: A whole new world for your baby
title: Your New Baby
content:
Created by BabyCenter Your newborn is new to this big, noisy world! You can
see he moves in a jerky way as he gets used to it. Soon, his movements will be
smoother. You may worry your baby isn't getting enough milk. If your baby is
feeding every 2 to 3 hours, or at least 8 times a day, then that is enough.
The colour of your baby's stools is a good way to check. They are black at
first and turn yellow by day 4. At about 2 weeks, your baby is sucking,
grasping, blinking and rooting for your nipple. Sometimes he will look
straight into your eyes. It is good to respond by looking back and smiling and
nodding. He is learning fast! Watch for your baby trying to lift his head when
he's lying on his belly. This is a way for him to get stronger. He might turn
his head from side to side. As he approaches 1 month old, your baby begins to
lose his newborn quiver and jumpiness. He is growing stronger every day and
learning about the world around him. He might stare at you now. One exciting
change is he's beginning to make baby noises. This is his way of talking to
you! Try to make baby noises back. Keep talking even when you put him down and
move away.
